@blueorangutan test
@rhtyd a Trillian-Jenkins test job (centos7 mgmt + kvm-centos7) has been kicked to run smoke tests
@rhtyd rebase done

I see a few open bullet points in the PR's heading. How are we with those?

This feature would be awesome for 4.11

@rhtyd 

Can you test and verify the Process API change
For the 1st one (Marvin test case) I will definitively need some help as I have no clue on how to write one. The rest will be done, I hope by next week.

SystemVMs now start in about 10 seconds without requiring to be rebooted :smile:

Packaging result: ✔centos6 ✔centos7 ✔debian. JID-1309
@nathanejohnson: Not to point a finger, but without this it never worked properly. Although it seemed to work as VirtIO-SCSI it was actually just plain SCSI.

@wido when using linux, it recognizes as a VIRTIO-Scsi HBA, and when spinning up Windows guests with the Virtio SCSI drivers installed it recognizes the storage appropriately.  That doesn't "prove" it's actually using it as virtio-scsi, but it's possible when the "model" is not specified (or incorrectly specified) it might default to "auto", which might do the right thing based on OS support?  I'm guessing here. 

![screen shot 2017-11-27 at 10 34 15 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1360240/33277628-b5d72e6a-d35e-11e7-9146-a46ba9dca5d6.png)
